item.title: Understanding Arithmetic Operator Precedence and Associativity
item.description: Arithmetic operators are the backbone of mathematical operations in programming, enabling developers to perform calculations. To master these operators, it’s essential to grasp not only their basic functionality but also how parentheses influence operator precedence and associativity. In this article, we’ll explore arithmetic operators, delve into the importance of parentheses, and understand associativity with practical examples. Arithmetic Operators Arithmetic operators are symbols that allow us to perform basic mathematical operations. The common arithmetic operators include addition (+), subtraction (-), multiplication (*), division (/), and exponentiation (^).
